meanings.definition: Kept for a particular purpose or person.
meanings.sent1: She always kept a reserved seat for her best friend at the movies.
meanings.sent2: The librarian was reserved with the rare books, handling them carefully.
meanings.sent3: The cake was reserved for the birthday girl, but the cat got to it first!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a reserved treasure, only shared with those closest to her.
meanings.sent5: The secret garden was a reserved paradise, hidden from the rest of the world.

meanings.sent1: He was always reserved in his opinions, never wanting to offend anyone.
meanings.sent2: The shy student was reserved in class, speaking only when necessary.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's reserved performance left the audience puzzled.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like a reserved lake, calm on the surface but deep underneath.
meanings.sent5: The forest was so quiet, it felt almost reserved, as if nature was holding its breath.

meanings.definition: A space set aside for a specific purpose.
meanings.sent1: The restaurant had a reserved section for special events.
meanings.sent2: She placed a reserved sign on the table to save it for her friends.
meanings.sent3: The reserved parking spot was always empty when he arrived late.
meanings.sent4: The museum had a reserved room for ancient artifacts, locked away from the public.
meanings.sent5: The theater had a reserved balcony for VIP guests, offering the best view in the house.
